From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: tuareg

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Tuareg languages
Wikipedia
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Tuareg people
Wikipedia

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Taurick (obsolete)
  • Touareg

Etymology

[edit]

From Hassaniya Arabic طوارق (ṭwāreg), plural of طارق (ṭāreg, “inhabitant of Fezzan”), from Berber targa (“Fezzan”, literally “drainage channel”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (UK) IPA(key): /ˈtwɑː.ɹɛɡ/
  • (US) IPA(key): /ˈtwɑɹ.ɛɡ/

Noun

[edit]

Tuareg (plural Tuaregs or Tuareg)

  1. A member of a traditionally nomadic Berber people of the Sahara.
    Synonym: Imohagh

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Tuareg Sloughi

Translations

[edit]
member of the Tuareg people
  • Arabic: طَارِق (ar) m sg (ṭāriq), طَوَارِق pl (ṭawāriq)
    Hijazi Arabic: طَارِق m sg (ṭārig)
  • Armenian: տուարեգ (tuareg)
  • Dutch: Toeareg m or f
  • Finnish: tuaregi (fi)
  • French: Touareg (fr) m
  • German: Targi (de) m, Targia f, Targiya f, Tuareg (de) m or f, Tuareg (de) pl, Tuaregs (de) pl
  • Greek: Τουαρέγκ m or f (Touarégk)
  • Persian: طوارق (tavâreq)
  • Polish: Tuareg (pl) m or f
  • Russian: туаре́г (ru) m (tuarég)
  • Spanish: tuareg (es) m or f
  • Swedish: tuareg (sv) c
  • Tamil: தவாரிக் (tavārik)
  • Tuareg: Imuhaɣ, Imušaɣ, Imašeɣăn, Imajeɣăn
  • Ukrainian: туаре́г m (tuaréh)

Proper noun

[edit]

Tuareg

  1. Any of various Berber languages spoken by the Tuareg people.
    Synonym: Tamajaq

Translations

[edit]
various Berber languages
  • Finnish: tuaregi (fi)
  • French: Touareg (fr) m
  • German: Tamaschek (de) n, Tuareg (de) n
  • Persian: طوارقی (tavâreqi)
  • Polish: tuareski (pl) m
  • Spanish: targuí m, tuareg (es) m
  • Tamil: தவாரிக் மொழி (tavārik moḻi), தமஷிக் (tamaṣik)
  • Tuareg: please add this translation if you can

Anagrams

[edit]
  • rugate, Tauger, truage, argute, Ugarte
